contributors.headline: MSc, MBA, Co-founder@Collabros | Imagineer | Changemaker | Innovator | Dialogue Designer | Lab Facilitator | LifelongLearner

projects.title: Smart design for the prevention of littering
projects.description:
The project ‘Slim ontwerp voor de preventive van zwerfafval’ is based on the premise that if we take the prevention of litter into account during packaging design, and we apply a more considered approach towards the issuance of litter-sensitive materials, we can reduce litter. Research shows a positive relationship between the amount of litter on the streets and residents’ feelings of insecurity.
The focus in this project is on (1) manufacturers of snacks, candy and soft drinks and such for the redesign of packaging and (2) retailers and (3) fast food industry for the redesign of issuance of litter-sensitive materials. This project is a joint initiative of NederlandSchoon and KIDV, the knowledge center for sustainable packaging.

contributors.headline: MSc, MBA, Co-founder@Collabros | Imagineer | Changemaker | Innovator | Dialogue Designer | Lab Facilitator | LifelongLearner

projects.title: Urban Arts Entrepreneurs: a space for change
projects.description: Urban Arts Entrepreneurs (UAE) is a platform designed by members and for members of the urban arts community, through which they can collaboratively change their enterprise logic and the industry logic away from subsidies towards a more profit-oriented, entrepreneurial mindset. The UAE platform enables an industry-wide dialogue about the future of the urban arts and offers a space in which its members can learn from each other, explore, experiment and transform together. The UAE platform is specifically meant for urban arts member who understand that their creations and services have value that can be bargained against, and want to find out with others how they can make it work and become self-reliant. UAE is currently under development (hatching).

profile_positions.description: We developed #CollabrosLearningLab as a vehicle for innovation and transformation on behalf of Mondriaan Fonds. In this facilitated space we learned and co-created knowledge and meaning by engaging in generative and transformative dialogues with multiple stakeholders. On July 16th and August 15th we organized the first two sessions of the Streetart Edition, which were attended by graffiti artists, curators, aldermen, city councelers, art academy policymakers, real estate managers, creative minds and ofcourse a public fund for visual art and cultural heritage. In October 2022 we will continue the journey.
profile_positions.title: Designer Collabros Learning Lab | Streetart Edition Mondriaan Fonds

profile_positions.description: We are Collabros. For over 20 years our job was to coach, create, communicate, consult, curate but most of all collaborate with amazing talent and passionate communities. Today we help organizations, brands, municipalities and government agencies to understand and value the past and present of street culture. Join us in our lifelong mission to elevate the artistic expression of today’s international urban culture.
profile_positions.title: Designer of Participatory Processes

profile_positions.description: Olympic Goldrush is an inquiry on behalf of NADB, NOC*NSF, TeamNL Rotterdam and TeamNL Eindhoven on how to build the breakin' team that will represent the Netherlands during the 2024 Olympics in Paris, and what facilities are necessary to get them prepped up for that occasion. The first step was assembling all stakeholders (whole system) during the Olympic Goldrush conference on December 11, 2019 in Park theater Eindhoven where several topics regarding the Olympics were discussed. The second step was a series of interviews in the period 2020-2021 among the Bboy and Bgirl community, TeamNL Rotterdam and TeamNL Eindhoven. These two steps culminated into an advisory report presented to NADB, NOC*NSF, TeamNL as well as the establishment of qualification criteria and appointing certain competition as qualifiers.
profile_positions.title: Qualitative Research Project: Olympic Goldrush on behalf of NOC*NSF, NADB, TeamNL

profile_positions.description: Collabros conducted a feasibility study on behalf of the municipality of Amsterdam, among (hiphop) entrepreneurs in 'De Bijlmer'.
profile_positions.title: Qualitative Research Project Nieuwe Oost on behalf of Amsterdam Municipality

profile_positions.description: Working on the project ‘Slim ontwerp voor de preventive van zwerfafval’ which is based on the premise that if we take litter prevention into account during packaging design, and we redesign the issuance of litter-sensitive materials, we can reduce litter. The focus in this project is on manufacturers (e.g. snacks, candy, soft drinks, etc.) for the redesign of packaging, and retailers and fast food industry for the redesign of issuance process. Key is the design of a process to come to innovative solutions through a participatory approach, bringing different stakeholders together. This project is a joint initiative of NederlandSchoon and KIDV.
profile_positions.title: Interim Projectleider 'Slim Ontwerp voor de preventie voor zwerfafval'

profile_positions.description:
Creative Scrum is a networked creative consultancy of consultants who use a complexity-inspired design approach for innovation and transformation. At Creative Scrum we use the narrative mode as an additional lens and shift the focus from the outcome to the process. The strategy emerges through interactions between the participants in the process; it is a continuous dialogue.
Experienced in various sectors: government, hospitality, arts, education, charity, financial, telecom, advertising.

profile_positions.description: Organizing and designing the content for the conference Olympic Gold Rush in Parktheater Eindhoven on 11th December 2019, bringing together all stakeholders who have contributed (knowingly and unknowingly) to the infrastructure of breakdance and who - now that breakdance is becoming an Olympic discipline in Paris 2024 - will continue to contribute in moving breaking further forward in the coming years. Present were the breaking community, international specialists on the judging system, MBO dance and MBO sports educators, NOC*NSF, CTO Zuid, Rotterdam Topsport, among others.

company.name: CBI - Centre for the Promotion of Imports from developing countries

profile_positions.company: CBI - Centre for the Promotion of Imports from developing countries
profile_positions.description:
Designing and facilitating a 3-day innovation workshop for Kenyan tourists boards and tourist SMEs on behalf of CBI, the agency of the ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands. 
Applying service design thinking methodology we sparked sectoral collaboration between different independent parties in the tourism industry in Kenya. During a context-specific training in Nairobi with tourism SME’s and Kenya Tourism Boards, we created a dialogue space in which new ways of cooperation were explored and co-created through reflective and generative dialogue. https://bit.ly/34io1KC
